msItem.title: መጽሐፈ ፡ ምሥጢር
msItem.note: Introduction, fol. 1r-3v; on the heresy of Sabellius, fol. 3v-9r; on a heresy of Apollinarius, fol. 9r-13v; on the heresy of Arius, fol. 14r-21r; on the heresy of Nestorius, fol. 21r-31r; on the heresy of Photinus, fol. 31r-43v; on a heresy of Origen, fol. 43v-46v; on the heresy of those who say that the Word of God was transformed to be flesh, blood, bone, hair, and tendon, fol. 47r-49v; on the heresy of those who say that the existence of the holy spirit is after the baptism of Christ, fol. 49v-51r; homily on Mary entitled "The white bird with silver wings and a golden torso", fol. 51r-54v; on the heresy of Bitu, fol. 54v-63r; against the Antidicomarianites, fol. 63r-65r; homily of Retu'a Hāymānot to strengthen the faithful in their belief in Jesus Christ, fol. 65v-71r; homily of one of the orthodox of Ethiopia on the footwashing, fol. 71v-74v; on the heresy of Eutyches, fol. 74v-81r; on the heresy of Severos of India and Theodosios of Alexandria, fol. 81v-84v; on another heresy of Apollinarius, fol. 84v-88r; on the heresy of Eutychius, fol. 88v-91r; on the heresy of Mani, fol. 91r-94v; on the heretics who teach that Christ descended to hell in soul and flesh, fol. 94v-98r; on the heresy of Leo, fol. 98r-110v; against the Council of Chalcedon, fol. 110v-114r; against the Phantasiasts, fol. 114r-119r; against those who believe that children receive their souls forty days after birth, fol. 119r-123r; on another heresy of Origen, fol. 123r-129v; against those who do not believe in the transformation of the bread and wine, fol. 129v-138r; homily on the Ten Commandments, fol. 138r-157v; against those who believe that the soul dies with the flesh, fol. 157v-170v; on the heresy of Flavian, fol. 170v-175r; on the heresy of Macedonius, fol. 175r-187r; against those who follow the teaching of the Sadducees, fol. 187r-194r; colophon, fol. 194v-195r
msItem.colophon: Colophon specifies that the MS was copied by ክበበ ፡ ሀብተ ፡ ማርያም (baptismal name ተስፋ ፡ ማርያም)

history.provenance: Copied for Giyorgis (prayers, f. 9a and passim). In Patriarchate Library when filmed.
